variants.Description in input context: A missense mutation in the kinase domain, leading to increased kinase activity and substrate phosphorylation.
A missense mutation in the GTPase domain, associated with altered kinase activity and phosphorylation of downstream substrates.

Material used.Description: The experiment used recombinant LRRK2 proteins (wild-type, G2019S, and R1441C) for kinase activity measurements.

Readout description.Result Description: The G2019S variant showed a 2.5-fold increase in kinase activity compared to wild-type LRRK2.
The R1441C variant exhibited a 1.8-fold increase in kinase activity compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 20% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity exceeding 50% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with wild-type and variant LRRK2 constructs to measure substrate phosphorylation.

Readout description.Result Description: The G2019S variant caused a 3.2-fold increase in phosphorylation of the substrate MAPT compared to wild-type.
The R1441C variant led to a 2.1-fold increase in phosphorylation of the substrate MAPT compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Substrate phosphorylation within 20% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Substrate phosphorylation exceeding 50% of wild-type levels.
